questions.text: All of the following are causes of vitamin B12 deficiency except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Celiac disease affects proximal intestine. B12 is absorbed through distal intestine.

questions.text: Most common site affected in Crohn’s disease-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Most common site affected in Crohn’s disease-Ileum.

questions.text: Which of the following investigation is more specific for alcoholic hepatitis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

AST/ALT ratio more than 2 

Because of deficiency of pyridoxal phosphate ALT synthesis decreases in alcoholics.

questions.text: Which of the following is the cause of conjugated hyperbilirubinemia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Rotor’s syndrome causes conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. 

Causes of unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia

•	Crigler Najjar syndrome

•	Hemolysis

•	Novobocin drug

questions.text: Zieve’s syndrome is seen in
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Zieve’s syndrome is seen in Alcoholic liver disease. Hepatitis with anemia in alcoholic patient is called as Zieve’s syndrome.

questions.text: Which of the following antibody is associated with autoimmune hepatitis type 2?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Anti- LKM 1

LKM-1 Autoimmune hepatitis 2

LKM-2 Drug induced hepatitis

LKM-3 Chronic hepatitis D

questions.text: Nazer index is used in
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Nazer index is used in Wilson’s disease.

questions.text: A 46 year old male is having ascites. Ascitic fluid analysis showed ascitic albumin = 3 gm/dl. Serum albumin is 6 gm/dl. What is SAAG for this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

SAAG is Serum Ascitic Albumin gradient. It is calculated as
SAAG = (Serum Albumin – Ascitic Albumin)

questions.text: Most specific investigation for Helicobacter pylori is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Most specific investigation for Helicobacter pylori is Culture.

questions.text: All of the following are associated with acromegaly, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Heel-Pad thickness increases in GH hypersecretion due to increased soft tissue growth.

questions.text: All are features of Cushing’s syndrome EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

ACTH stimulates androgen secretion and it causes hirsutism.

questions.text: Addison’s disease is –
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Addison’s disease is – Primary adrenal insufficiency.

questions.text: Tolvaptan is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Tolvaptan is selective  V2 receptor antagonist.

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding central diabetes insipidus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Urine osmolality decreases.

choices.text: Fasting plasma glucose 100mg/dL and 2 hour prandial glucose 140 mg/dL
Fasting plasma glucose 125 mg/dL and 2 hour postprandial glucose 199 mg/dL
Symptoms of diabetes plus random blood glucose of 190 mg/dl

questions.text: Which of the following findings can establish a diagnosis of diabetes mellitus:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Most common pulmonary manifestation of SLE:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Pleuritis

questions.text: Which of the following can not be diagnosed without positive ANA
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

SLE

choices.text: Tender, located on extensor surface and seen with arthritis
Non-tender, located on extensor surface and seen with arthritis
Non-tender, located on flexor surface and seen with arthritis
Tender, located on flexor surface and seen with arthritis

questions.text: Correct about Rheumatoid nodules?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Non-tender, located on extensor surface and seen with arthritis

questions.text: Joint usually not involved in Rheumatoid arthritis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

D.I.P

questions.text: All are seen in rheumatoid arthritis EXCEPT:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Sero-negative arthritis

questions.text: Rheumatoid arthritis is seen with?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

HLA DRB-1

questions.text: Pulseless disease is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Takayasu's arteritis

questions.text: Wegener's granulomatosis is diagnosed by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

c-ANCA

questions.text: Most common pituitary hyper-secretion syndrome is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hyperprolactinemia

questions.text: Acromegaly is associated with all of the following except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Dry skin

questions.text: Contraindications for growth hormone therapy is-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All of the above

questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pegvisomant

questions.text: Which of the following is cause of cushing’s disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Pituitary adenoma

questions.text: NOT seen in cushing’s syndrome is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Hypoglycaemia

choices.text: Autoimmune is one of the cause
Weight loss is one of the clinical feature

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Addison’s disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

↓ ACTH, normal aldosterone, normal renin

questions.text: All of the following causes indirect hyperbilirubinemia Except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Dubin Johnson syndrome

choices.text: Chronic hepatitis B infection with high infectivity
Acute hepatitis infection with high infectivity
Chronic hepatitis infection with low infectivity
Acute hepatitis infection with low infectivity

questions.text: A 30 year old man presented with nausea, fever and jaundice of 5 days duration. The biochemical tests revealed a bilirubin of 6.7 mg/dl (Conjugated 5 mg/dl) with AST 900 IU/ml and ALT 1400 IU/ml. The serological tests showed the presence of HBsAg, IgM anti HBC and Anti-HBeAg. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Acute hepatitis infection with low infectivity

questions.text: Presence of HCV RNA and IgG-Anti-HCV suggest
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Chronic hepatitis C

questions.text: Which of the following is not a parameter used in prognostic index of NAZER?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Serum albumin

questions.text: Identify the sign
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Puddle sign

choices.text: Generally it is associated with diabetes

questions.text: Which of the following sentence is false regarding NAFLD?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

AST:ALT ratio is generally > 2

choices.text: It is more common in female
50% cases are associated with chron’s disease
It is associated with antimitochondrial antibodies
ERCP or MRCP requires for diagnosis

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding primary sclerosing cholangitis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

ERCP or MRCP requires for diagnosis

questions.text: All of the following are clinical features of hemochromatosis due to deposition of excessive iron EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Arthropathy

questions.text: A 55 year old female she is having amenorrhoea, galactorrhoea and infertility. She is a known case of Diabetes mellitus, Hypertension, Hypothyroid and chronic tension type headache. She is taking metformin for Diabetes, telmisartan for hypertension, levothyroxine for hypothyroidism and amitriptyline for chronic tension type of headache.Which of the following drug should be stopped or replaced?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Amitriptyline

DRUG INDUCED HYPERSECRETION OF PROLACTIN

questions.text: A 30 year old female comes to opd with chief complaints of amenorrhoea, galactorrhoea and infertility. She is a known case of  Tourette's disorder and taking haloperidol since 4 to 6 months. On blood investigations serum prolactin level is increased. What should be the next step in the management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Replace Haloperidol

DRUG INDUCED HYPERSECRETION OF PROLACTIN

questions.text: Which of the following hormone hypersecretion leads to the condition shown in the figure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Growth hormone

Prognathism because of mandible enlargement the clinical feature.

questions.text: A middle-aged man noticed that he can no longer fit in his shoes and that his jaw was protruding and phalanges were enlarged. Which investigation should be done as a screening test?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

IGF – I level

IGF 1 is screening test.

Glucose induced GH suppression is confirmatory test.

choices.text: Trans-sphenoidal surgical resection of pituitary adenoma

questions.text: A 46 year old male came to OPD with chief complaints of central obesity, purple stretch marks on abdomen, weight gain and redness of cheeks. No history of any drug. On examination BP 160/90 mmhg, proximal muscle weakness present. Blood investigations are RBS 334 mg/dl, serum potassium 2.9 mcg/L, serum ACTH level is decreased and serum cortisol level is increased. MRI brain showed pituitary adenoma. What should next appropriate step?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

CT abdomen for adrenal 

Clinical features of cushing’s syndrome present. ACTH is decreased means Pituitary adenoma is nonactive. And Cortisol is secreted by adrenal tumor.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a clinical feature of Cushing’s syndrome because of adrenal carcinoma?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Hirsuitism

questions.text: Choose the best Lab value for a patient with nephrogenic diabetes insipidus:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

As in nephrogenic DI Urine OSM decreases, serum osm increases and serum ADH increases.
